title: Janitor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Penn Medicine in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Applied for a cleaning position and the on-person interview went well. However, everything that followed afterwards was an absolutely mess. 

They sent me an offer letter in an account that I never created when I applied for the job via referral. Since I couldn't accept the letter, they made manually re-apply online (submit job history, resume etc) . Then later I receive a rejection letter - turns out that was sent by mistake and they told me to ignore it. How terrible. 

Then they ask me to submit 4 references for this job (who asks for references AFTER you receive a job offer??). Countless online onboarding tasks. CAC clearances, FBI fingerprinting, drug testing. All of that, which I understand. But the way they provide all this info via email is so overwhelming. 

Also this job does not require a HS diploma, yet I've been asked twice by two different people via email to submit one or else I'll lose the job. Then for my Workday account, they already created a login credential for me however I had to dig through all the emails they sent me in the past week just to find it. They also needed an actual copy of my flu shot in addition to my covid vaccine, however I received my flu shot at a pharmacy which did not provide me any proof. So I had to circle back to CVS to try to get sufficient proof. Also no info provided on dress attire, so I'm not even sure what kind of scrubs to purchase before the first day to prepare. 

All in all, this is possibly the worst/most frustrating onboarding process I have ever experienced for a new job. So many countless hoops to jump through. All this just for a janitorial position that pays less than the other place I applied to.
Interview Questions: What previous experience do you have?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview went very well. I had a tour of the unit and hospital. Then I had an interview with the nurse manager and assistant manager. The interview I believe went well and I look forward to working in the hospital.

title: Communications Interview

When I emailed, he responded hours later saying he had technical difficulties -- it was a phone interview.   Rescheduled and went fine... next interview via video. Again time off from work -- hour and 15 minutes said I'd go to the next step and then ghosted.  And I had worked with interviewers in the past and had a relationship-- super disappointed they didn't even have respect to follow-up.  Soured my impression of the medical center overall.
Interview Questions: Typical -- just a very long process and waste of time.

title: ICU Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and completed a self-survey assessment (personality based). Heard from HR 3 months later. Spoke to Talent Acquisition Specialist about the position. I was asked questions like "Why do you think you're a good fit?" "Why Penn? "What made you go into nursing?", Then, he set up an interview with the manager of ICU floor I applied to. I went, met her, answered typical interview questions (no clinical scenarios though) and toured the unit and saw the type of acuity. I also had to have my references ready (2 past managers and 2 others) and they had to complete the survey within 2 days (so make sure you pick people than can do it promptly). Then I went home and waited for news. A week and a half later, HR calls me telling me I got the job! Then you have to do a background investigation with HireRight, which took about 5 days. Have your paystubs and diploma ready because that saved me from HireRight not being able to verify it (which takes longer). I proactively uploaded them (uploaded it before they requested it). Now I'm waiting to start!
Interview Questions:
-What would your past manager say about you?
-What was your relationship like with your past coworkers?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator A Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Penn Medicine in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I applied to this job in August of 2020 and was contacted by a hiring manager for a Zoom interview in January 2021 (?).  Interview was ~30 minutes. The interviewer was very nice, gave some good info about the position and day-to-day of the job. She said they were interviewing several other candidates later that week and next, so I should hear back within two weeks.

The hiring manager emailed me a few days after the interview asking if I was still interested in the position - though from the phrasing I couldn't tell whether she had forgotten that I'd already interviewed and was asking if I was still interested in setting up an interview, or if she was just asking if I was still interested post-interview. I said yes, and that I enjoyed talking to [interviewer]/learning more about the position. She said "That's great, I have not followed up with [interviewer] yet, but I will do so today and get back with you."

After that I never heard from her or the interviewer, despite following up again a week later. It seems extremely rude to just fully ghost any candidate post-interview, especially after directly promising to follow up. This seems to be pretty standard among hiring managers now - most people I've talked to who are applying to jobs/have done so recently have said they've also just never heard back after interviewing, in some cases after several rounds of interviews.

A form rejection letter or one sentence email saying "Sorry we've gone with another candidate" would be totally fine, but just completely ignoring people like this is so rude and unprofessional.
Interview Questions: What skills or qualities do you think are important for this position?

title: Clinical Nurse 2 Interview

During that interview, it was a virtual call with the manager of the unit, clinical nurse specialist and a RN from the unit. We had a nice chat lasting about 30 mins. She asked me questions about my job responsibilities at my previous position, my research project and also how do I handle difficult patients. 
I then proceeded to bite my nails waiting for the phone call in about 2 weeks time. She asked me for references. At this stage we are about 1 month since the application date.

1) Describe your job responsibilities at your previous job 
2) How do you deal with demanding patients or patients who were violent
3) Describe a typical day at work at your previous job 
4) Tell me more about your research project.

 Tell me about challenge?

title: Care Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn Medicine in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied for this position and got a phone call two days after. I did my due diligence and informed my potential supervisor that I wouldn't be able to get my LCSW within the time frame as listed on the job description. She told me it was fine, the interview went incredibly well I met with my supervisor and the team and was looking forward to working with them. There was some back and forth about the responsibilities of this position and the salary but ultimately I accepted their offer only to have it rescinded a week later. The HR department felt that the requirement was final and told me that if I didn't obtain my LCSW in 6 months I would be fired and because I couldn't get it in 6 months they took back their offer. They had the gall to tell me that should anything change in the future I should consider Penn. Now why would I do that? I gave notice at my job and was lucky enough to still be working with them. After this experience I would look at Penn with hesitation because they revoked my offer and they could do the same to you.

title: Director of Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied on-line for the position in January.  I had essentially forgotten about my application until 5 months later when out of the blue I received a request to complete a video interview within 48 hours.  I completed the interview and received an automated reply that it was received.  A month later and still no follow-up from Penn Medicine.

All in all an odd process.  At no point was I in direct contact with an resource from Penn Medicine, it was all form letters via e-mail.  There was no initial phone screen with HR or anyone else from the company.

Interview Questions: Why are you into research?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions:
Arduous.

After initially applying for the job on the website, apparently the job changed so three months passed before I heard back from a recruiter. The recruiter asked if I was still interested/available and schedule a phone interview. 

About a week after a short phone interview with the recruiter, I received an email invitation to complete an "On-Demand" video interview (via a site called Montage) within 72 hours. In the video interview, I was given five or six questions to answer while recording my response on my computer's camera. After each response was recorded, I could choose to accept or re-record my response. I re-recorded my first response a few times before I was satisfied. For the remaining questions, I wrote out my answers first and essentially taped cue cards behind my computer screen and did my best acting to read what I wrote in a natural tone and voice. I still ended up re-recording each of my responses at least twice. The video interview process took me two or three hours. (Later, I found a telepromter like app that would've probably work better.)

The following day, I received an acknowledgement that my video had been accepted and asked to take a healthcare assessment survey. Essentially, it was a personality inventory/survey of roughly 100 questions to determine if my personality type would be a good fit with the organization.

A week or 10 days later, I received an email from the hiring manager requesting a telephone interview. We set a time for the following week. At the appointed time, the hiring manager did not call. Within 15 minutes of the scheduled time, I got an email from the hiring manager apologizing and explaining an issue at Penn had come up which would require us to re-schedule our call for another day. Later that same week, we conducted the phone interview.

Another week or so passed before I heard back. This time, it was a request for an in person interview in Center City Philadelphia. This interview was with the hiring manager and another manager/director in the same department.

I heard back from Penn about a week or ten days later asking me to come in again for interviews with the hiring manager's supervisor and key stakeholders. During these interviews I met the team who would have the most interaction with the person hired. Before the day ended, I was given a case study to review and write a response.

Eight to ten weeks passed before I received the next email. It was a generic rejection letter.

Everyone was friendly and professional throughout the process.
Interview Questions: Besides the traditional questions related to my experience and background, the interview questions were typical behavioral and situational questions.

title: Clinical Nurse I Interview

title: Clinical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Business Administrator for the Department held the initial interview, followed by the direct supervisor and then some other staff. It lasted half the day with speaking to several people and going to/from several different buildings to meet with them.
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with sponsor-driven clinical trials?

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: This was my second time interviewing for a position at Penn Medicine and it will be my LAST because after this interview I realized I would NEVER work here. The interview I recently had (along with my previous one) was absolutely ridiculous. The interview started and I literally had no idea what the people interviewing me were talking about (and still don't) - something about belts, rankings.... things that no one would know unless you actually worked there! Then, I had to take the most ridiculous assessment (and similarly, I had to take an assessment for my last interview as well) - honestly I just think feel like they are looking for all geniuses to work at Penn and I'm smart but not a genius so I will happily seek employment elsewhere. Oh and I had to pay for my car to be valet parked during my interview. That right there just proves how many people they must have interviewing if they couldn't even validate/comp my parking.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the Penn portal and was contacted via email for a phone interview about a week later. I had a phone interview with a senior researcher and PI from the lab I had applied to. My academic background and research experience were discussed. A week after this, I was contacted with an invitation for an in person interview.
Interview Questions: They asked about my background in laboratory research and my familiarity with lab techniques.

title: Clinical Nurse I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I had worked there previously in a different role (before becoming an RN) and submitted my resume to one of the managers who knew me. HR contacted me to set up shadowing and an interview with a couple people who work in that unit. I got an offer less than a week later. Very efficient process. HR rep was very friendly - one person throughout the whole process.
Interview Questions: Difficult patient

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the Patient Access Representative Trainee through the Penn Medicine job website. After completing the application about an hour later I received and email from a recruiter requesting that I complete a survey/Personality test. After completing the personality test I was then sent a link for me to complete a video interview via the montage system. You record your answers to pre-selected questions. Upon approval of my interview I was sent a link to complete a prove it test. Two weeks after I completed the prove it test I received email notification of a face to face interview. Three days after completing my face to face interview I received a job offer.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a stressful situation with a patient?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Questions about past education, Medical philosophies,  and understanding how to conduct high quality research. They wanted to get to know my personality as best as possible with questions like "how do you maintain organization, how do you deal with conflict, what was a time that you had conflict and how did you deal with it"
Interview Questions: What is your understanding of the injustice that happens because of research and how to you see yourself being a tool to ensure ti doesn't happen.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Phila, PA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy. First a webcam interview and then a second interview with management and staff. Then hiring manager got back to me within a few days. After being offered the position, HR then calls you with your salary. I was an internal hire. I was only offered a $1.50 more than I was previously hired.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions nothing drastic

title: Research Specialist B/C Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
One 30 minute in-person interview to discuss laboratory experience and background.
Asked about technical and laboratory skills, time management, and interpersonal skills.
Asked whether or not I would be willing to work flexible hours.
Asked how I would make up a solution of a reagent given the salt and diluent.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable with mice?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Phila, PA)
Interview Descriptions:
I applied on Penn Medicine career webpage for full time an evening shift position. I was contacted shortly by dept to set up an in-person interview. Was interviewed by the supervisor and lead technologists. During the interview I was asked if I would take night shift position. I said no and she kept pressing me. I told her no. Next day, I received an email stating the evening shift position was filled by an internal candidate and there is only night shift position available. I replied wishing their team a success and asked her to let me know when day or evening shift positions become available.

Can't remember, it was few months ago. I was given a theoratical and a technical written test to complete during an interview. 

Completed the written test with all answers correct.
Interview Questions: Can't remember, it was few months ago. I was given a theoratical and a technical written test to complete during an interview.

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Two part interview. First part was about 3 standard questions asked by current recruiters. Final stage included an aggressive grilling with the department director. Without 5 years experience, hiring manager required a lot of convincing to believe I was qualified.
Interview Questions: What's the first word that comes to mind when you think of the color yellow?

title: Sonographer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: It seemed the place is organizing the person i had my interview was a little bit late but he gave me an excuse. The interview went well but they were looking for someone to cover the night shift and looking for a female.
Interview Questions: experience

title: Lead Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with HR.  The HR representative was more interested in my salary requirements than my actual qualifications, and rude, so I chose to not proceed with the process.  She was also not able to answer most of my questions about the position.
Interview Questions: How much are you making currently?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Phila, PA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Extensive so the more prepared you are with references and resume the better off you will be. Smiling and being sociable is key.  Ask question the interview as well, it shows how dedication.
Interview Questions: How would you handle work conflict?

title: Clinical Nurse I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I first had a phone interview with an HR recruiter for the unit. After the phone interview I was contacted to set up an in person interview that consisted of a 2 hour shadow experience with an 1 hour interview with the nurse manager following. During the sit down interview portion, the unit's nurse manager as well as the clinical nurse specialist and another unit nurse manager were present.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of a time you had a very difficult patient that made you unable to spend adequate time with your other patients. How did you handle this?

title: Clinical Nurse II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Franconia, PA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Generic 15 minute interview. Didn't really ask me anything about myself. Told me next step is to shadow which I did for four hours two days later. Followed up with thank you email. Never got a response.
Interview Questions: So why Penn?

title: Patient Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took some time. It took about 3 months from application date to start date. There was a phone interview, video interview, survey, assessment, and two 30-minute in-person interviews. The 1-on-1 interviews included about 5-7 behavioral questions each. I felt they really learned a lot about my work ethic in the short 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Explain to me a time when there was problem in your workplace and how you fixed it.

title: Patient Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Radnor, PA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted within a couple weeks of application (although I know most people say it can take several months to complete the whole interview process). Normal interview with practice manager and coordinator. Came back about a week later to shadow.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths/weaknesses?

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Confusing, human resources and recruitment personnel were too busy and overwhelmed. Interview was quick and impersonal and was more of 15minute advertisement followed by, " any question's? When can you start?"
Interview Questions: Standard question's, "Where do you see yourself in 10 years...?"

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Radnor, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I knew someone who was already working at Penn Medicine, they helped pass my resume along. If you do not know someone, good luck. It's a large hospital, and hearing back or getting an interview is a long process. Once I was hired, I was offered the job and started within 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: how do you deal with difficult people

title: Blood Bank Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a position online on 03/17/2016. I received a phone call to schedule an interview next day. I was scheduled for face to face interview one week later. I had online references to be completed. I was offered a position by week 3.
Interview Questions: Questions were basic: they asked about my past experience, the systems I have used.Everyone was very friendly.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview went well but I didn’t like the fact that they asked former nurses that you’ve worked with for a references about you instead of doing a professional reference.
Interview Questions: Do you get along well with others ?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
Applied in early January..received a phone call first for a phone screen interview later that week and scheduled an in person for the following week. Phone screen was lengthly and took about an hour. A lot of situational questions. In person interview was very pleasant. Met with the manager who went over the orientation process and then sent me to interview with a nurse on the unit for about an hour.

Took about two weeks to get a reference request and then received an offer a week after the completed reference check
Interview Questions: Tell me about a situation when you made a mistake

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email for a recruiter prompting me to do a survey 2 days later. Afterwards I received a call from hr for a brief phone interview 5mins. She scheduled me for my first interview with took place  a week later. At the interview I was informed that they'd like to arrange a follow up interview with a colleague. The first interview was pretty straight forward. And took only  30mins. I was walked around the unit and introduced. The second was mostly  informational.
Interview Questions:
If I called you last employer what would they say you greatest strength is, weakness?  
How do you handle difficult patients?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward: found the position on line and applied. A recruiter contacted me within 3 weeks. I was scheduled for a face to face interview a week after the phone interview. I was hired by week 4.
Interview Questions: What do you know about clinical trials?

title: Billing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Received an email with behavioral test. Then received call from department manager to set up interview for the following week. However, did not receive a follow up call for 7 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why are you a qualified candidate?

title: A/R Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: You have to fill out a questionnaire and a montage video before the actual interview. They make you answer three questions about yourself and experience. They then call with a phone interview. Normal phone interview questions were asked. Interviewed with 3 people the assistant Supervisor, supivisor, and manager. Questions included more information about yourself and experience as well as how you conduct yourself in an office setting. They also asked of knowledge about specific systems.
Interview Questions: What makes you a qualified candidate?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Phila, PA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: First there was a screen interview where you would record your answers to questions they display on a screen, when you are considered then a face to face interview was set up.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a difficult patient?

title: Medical Records Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Cherry Hill, NJ) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied for this position in January 2015 but wasn't contacted for an interview until March.  This particular interview was in-person.  I was interviewed by the practice manager as well as the head of the location's medical records supervisor.  Overall, the experience went fairly well, and my interviewers seemed like nice people.  This particular location also seemed to treat the patients they serviced fairly well too.  The interviewers didn't ask me questions that were too hard to answer.  The majority of the questions asked pertained to the extent of my exposure to patient records, particularly, how experienced I was in dealing with EHRs (electronic health records).  Only a couple questions were asked regarding some of the skills and education I listed on my résumé.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with Epic and if so, how often did you use it at your last job?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Started off with Phone screen which lasted around eight mins. Then three weeks later had an 2 1/2 hr in-person interview and panel interview which went really well. I was offered a opportunity to shadow on a day of my choosing. I received a phone call for a job offer two days later. Great Experience overall.
Interview Questions: Name a time you acted as a mentor or leader

title: Unit Clerk Prn Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process was great interview less than 45 minutes. Met with Nurse Manager and Senior Clerk both were great. Interview went really well. I got a call back a week later for reference check.
Interview Questions: What is an area I need to improve.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: interview process was weak. spoke with preceptor about certain topics and projects you would be working on during the course of the internship. Then you had to get a background check and a drug test IF you were selected for the internship program. This program was based on a first come, first serve basis with the obvious notion that you were B+-A student in college.
Interview Questions: Why Penn Medicine?

title: Associate Training Education Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by an internal recruiter about the position. Was asked to do an online questionnaire and video interview process in which I answered several questions about my past experiences and history. I also scheduled time to speak on the phone. I completed the video interview process and spoke briefly to the recruiter on the phone. I was told everything looked good and to expect to hear back in a week or two to schedule a follow up interview. I never heard back.
Interview Questions: Provide an example of a learning intervention you implemented or instructional strategies you used which was successful. Why do you think it worked well? How did you make sure that the skills were successfully transferred to the work situation?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty simple. They asked about any type of experience I had volunteering. I was also given a packet which I had to read and there were questions at the end that had to be answered. Overall, the interview process was very easy and the volunteer office was very accomadting as well.
Interview Questions: Do you have any previous experience volunteering somewhere else?

title: Senior Compliance Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Phila, PA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: HR manager suggested I apply for the position.  I did and the hiring manager from the department decided to do a phone interview.  An date was made and my phone interview lasted approximately fifteen minutes.
Interview Questions: How are you qualified for this position?

title: Desktop Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: interview process was nice and smooth.  was a great job experience.  The interview was long but worth the time after starting.  I applied several times over the years and loved the experience
Interview Questions: describe your weakness

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: People in the office were all very friendly. The HR contact didn't give me the direction are agenda prior to the interview. I reached out to her several times however she never returned my calls.  I got the information the AM of the interview while I was driving to the company. The interviews were 1:1 sessions. Pleasant until got to the hiring manger. She looked tired and wasn't particularity friendly.  I thought it would be a great place to work.. Behavioral interview. Be prepared.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your last project the did not go well.

title: Coding Academy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Phila, PA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Arduous and rewarding interview experience. Felt like you accomplished something substantial at the end of the process. Had to take 3 hr. Skills test which was rigorous. Made the cut of 20 out of 75 who took test. Then came 1 on one interview down to final 13.
Interview Questions: Video interview with automated questions. Very exhaustive.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for a med/surg RN position as a new grad. The nurse manager was kind, the interview was very laid back. I then came back and shadowed before they officially accepted me.
Interview Questions: They asked about my critical thinking skills, background, and why I wanted to be on the unit.

title: Senior Medical Secertary Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume through current employee. Got a call the next day than interviewed a week later got an offer the next day. Tried to negotiate didn't work.
Interview Questions: Didn't really ask to many questions told me about the job.

title: Senior Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Wasn't bad at all. The interview was very fair. Was honest about skills
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Marketing Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty standard. I applied to the position online and was contacted for an interview about 2 weeks after. On-site, I met with a specific business/product  manager as well as a higher level department head (VP). They were hiring 2 roles and when I arrived it turned out that one had already been filled internally, which was disappointing to hear.
Interview Questions: Interview mostly involved questions regarding experience and fit for the position. Tell me about yourself and current job. Why do you want the position? Strengths, weaknesses, etc.

title: IT Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Penn Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The supervisor who interviewed me was instantly dislikable; the type of guy who looked like he could suck the life out of a room just by walking in.  His answers to my questions were curt bordering on rude, he seemed uncommunicative, and appeared to be absolutely miserable working there.  He must have used the bathroom prior to meeting me because he had urine stains all over the front of his khakis, yet he stressed several times the importance of looking presentable on the job.  Seemed like he would be an awful person to work for.
Interview Questions: None, really.  He did all the talking.

title: Supervisor, Patient Registration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine
Interview Descriptions: First I recieved an email from HR aasking for a few times thatbworked for me that we could talk. Reviewed experiences on my resume tailoring previous duties to those of the job I wad interviewing for.  Recruiter was very pleasant.  We set up a day and time for me to come in and interview with one of the other supervisors and the manager who were both friendly. Department tour showed a bunch of hard working people with poor attitudes. Management viewed employees as well beneath them and communication showed.
Interview Questions: Do you have a problem asking for co pays and deductibles up front?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The whole process was a rocky situation didn't know if you actually had the position or not it was a hit or miss they where not team players and gave off awful signals
Interview Questions: What do expect from our company.

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Hiring and Interview process was seemless. Met with HR coordinator and then with principal investigator. Questions were very simple and based on past experience.
Interview Questions: Describe your greatest weakness

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had already been working in the department for 3 years and knew a lot of people that would help make this job transition easier. The job opened up, I applied , and was chosen for an interview. I met with the Program Director and the Practice Coordinator for about an hour. I already knew them so some general interview questions were never even discussed.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with HR first and then nurse manager. HR interviewer was a very general interview. Asked about resume and why I chose the hospital and other generic questions. Nurse manager interview was specific to my major and role I was filling. They definitely want to hear why you are interested in HUP in particular and the specialty you are interviewing for.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses

title: Resource Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I met  with everyone in the lab, about 25 people total. The meeting took about 3 hours, meeting with small groups or individuals at a time. Went on a lab tour to observe the facility and the process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Biomedical Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Penn Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by on site interview
Interview Questions: Do you want to stay in academia or industry?

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: The process was very slow and lengthy. Weeks after submitting an online application, a recruiter called me to schedule a phone screen. I was contacted within a reasonable amount of time after this to let me know someone would be reaching out to schedule a 1:1 interview, but this took quite a bit longer. Then, once I did have the 1:1, the follow up was extremely slow, and I eventually found another job.
Interview Questions: The screening process was focused on personality type.

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn Medicine in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had 11, yes 11 interviews, for a mid-level position. I kept being told my chances were good and interviews 5-11 were just formalities...they weren't, I never got the job. It was my fault for not keeping all of my options open, but I had turned down other opportunities during this process for the chance to work at Penn. It took me another year and a half to get my current (fantastic) job, so it wasn't a total waste, but I wish they would streamline their process for the future.
Interview Questions: One of my last interviewers came out to get me, declared she was having a bad day and wanted to get our interview over with. She was distracted during the whole process and asked me questions about the organization only internal people (in other departments HR and Finance) would know. When I tripped up on them she would get annoyed.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Phila, PA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward process.  One interview with staff member, moved onto final interview with Executive.  Was told the following day that I had the job.  One on one.  I didn't feel pressure, everyone was every nice.  Very formal offer letter with benefits stated. I can only say positive things for the entire interview.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 2 years?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Overall my hiring and interview process was amazing. My interviewer ended up being my manager and she was by far the best manager I ever had. Sometimes I actually wish I still worked for her. She was so welcoming during the interview process and was very informative on what the job was going to be like once I was hired.
Interview Questions: She asked me what I would change about myself when it came to working.

title: PSR II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR rep and one face to face with Practice Manager. Interview consisted of mostly behavioral questions and the entire process lasted about a month with large gaps in communication in between from Practice Manager.
Interview Questions: All behavioral questions

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Excellent background checks by outside vendor,
long interview period
very competitive to get hired
Interview Questions: what don't you like about nursing.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was to three interviews (does not include the phone screen).  All of the people I interacted with were very professional, pleasant and helpful.  Not sure of the culture, as I think you need to be in the workplace for more than just an interview.
Interview Questions: How would I manage, not knowing the system from a technical perspective.

title: Biomedical Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Was invited up to give a presentation.  Met with lab staff and taken out to dinner.  Hiring manager got back to me within a week to let me know I had the position.
Interview Questions: What types of projects are you interested in working on?

title: Pathology Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant experience interviewing with the pathology attending physicians. A good tour of the hospital was given and the experience was very personal. A good lunch was served and the pathology residents all seemed to be very happy.
Interview Questions: How would I get along with people who were much younger than I was.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Innitial communications were done by phone and the conversation was brief lasting around 20-30 minutes.  In the interview basic fit, background, and neurology questions were asked.  In the second round interview an in person meeting was required where both the PI and director were present.  At the second interview, staining, sectioning, and the evaluation of slides from the prevalence/severity of  neurodegenerative diseases were highlighted.  Following the second interview a position was offered.
Interview Questions: To assign a rating of disease progression in a post-mortem stained slide for the severity of Alzheimer's

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Originally interviewed with the Corporal on the shift then the Sergent and Director of the Security Department.  Had to take a psych personality test as well as demonstrate hand gun proficiency at the range to obtain ACT 235 certification.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable being constantly outnumbered?

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Extensive for me after so many years working within the institution. My counter part had no such obligation and was given the job without going through the interviewing process.
Interview Questions: Explain why I obtained my master's degree in Health Education and not Business Administration?

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: I went through two interviews with the Business Administrator, one with the Medical Director, and one with the Driector of Operations for the the Department.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Administrative Support Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Penn Medicine in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: My resume was submitted to a department from an application pool where I submitted my resume.  I was called from a department a couple weeks later and called in for an interview.  I interviewed with two people.  I was called back again for a second interview with two other people.  The interviews went really well, but they needed to hire someone quickly and found someone already working within the organization.
Interview Questions: What do you think is one of your weaknesses?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then met with the research coordinator for a 1:1 interview. We talked about my research experience and time commitment/ salary expectations for the position.
Interview Questions: What research experience do you have?

title: Financial-Operations Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2008
Interview Descriptions: Other than the obvious tip of selling your skills and experience, I found it beneficial to simply be yourself. Since you will be working with your colleagues for the majority of your waking day, it is important to have some type of rapport with them. Make sure the work environment is something that motivates you.
Interview Questions: questions regarding an earlier experience...be ready to provide some details to those "old" jobs.

title: Financial Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Penn Medicine (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the supervisor and manager of the department as well a manager from another department.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you a had a problem to deal with and no one from management to assist you?  How did you handle it?
